news.title: The alleged 'sweeping betrayal of trust' that rocked Zions bank and spooked Wall Street
news.summary: Zions Bancorporation lost $1 billion of its valuation in a single day on Thursday after disclosing $60 million worth of loans it had made that were unlikely to be repaid.

news.title: Trump commutes prison sentence of ex-GOP Rep. George Santos
news.summary: Trump said he began thinking about Santos after being reminded of a controversy about Democratic Sen. Richard Blumenthal's military service claims. Trump said he was reminded of the controversy about Blumenthal.

news.title: Warren Buffett's master class on the problem with gold
news.summary: The gold rally has some strategists arguing it should now take a permanent place in diversified portfolios. Buffett rejects it as a long-term investment.

news.title: Proxy advisor ISS recommends Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk $1 trillion pay plan
news.summary: Institutional Shareholder Services recommended Tesla investors vote against a pay plan for CEO Elon Musk that would grant him nearly $1 trillion more in stock.

news.title: Utilities grapple with a multibillion question: How much AI data center power demand is real
news.summary: The tech industry is shopping the same big projects around to multiple utilities as they look for the quickest access to power. The companies are looking for the fastest way to get the power they need.

news.title: ‘I watch antenna TV’: I’m 66. Will I lose my disability benefits if Social Security goes belly up?
news.summary: “I read that the Social Security Disability Insurance Trust Fund is good until 2099,” he says. “I’m glad that’s the case.”

news.title: My stepdaughter is buying a house. Can her soon-to-be ex-husband claim a share?
news.summary: “Her real-estate agent has assured her that she has nothing to worry about,” a spokesman for the family said. “She’s in good spirits,’ the spokesman said.

news.title: This secret ingredient of the economy says things are OK — and no recession is brewing
news.summary: When the economy shows sign of stress, one of the first things Americans strike from their budgets is frequent takeout dinners and restaurant reservations. It’s an early warning sign of recession.

news.title: U.S. passport power plunges — and ‘worried’ Americans are searching for second passports and golden visas
news.summary: Many Americans aren’t necessarily looking to move overseas. They’re looking for a Plan B. The U.S. economy is in a recession, but it’s still growing.

news.title: We’re in our 70s. How do we withdraw $6 million from our retirement fund without getting killed on taxes?
news.summary: Some of the stocks pay dividends totaling around $90,000 annually. “Some of these stocks pay dividend totaling about $90k annually,” the company says.
